page.title: 04 SITUATION AND GEOLOGY PART2
page.content: In earlier times the scene would have been more romantic, with the towers and bulk of Reading Abbey in place of the gasometers, and the hall and gatehouse of the Bishop of Sarum's manor house showing on the hill above Sonning Church, the whole panorama backed by the seemingly impenetrable and limitless timber belt of Windsor Forest and its adjoining woodlands. In places the chalk comes to the surface, but at other levels it is capped with gravels and London clay, often to a considerable depth where there are underlying folds - a complicating factor in the problem of waste water and sewage disposal with which many householders have found difficulty in coping.
